{{Infobox person |name = Petar Dyaksov |image = Dyaksov_2017.jpg |birth_date = {{birth date and age|1989|10|1|df=y}} |birth_place = [[Plovdiv]], Bulgaria |nationality = Bulgarian |education = [[University of Essex]]
[[Aston University]] |occupation = [[Businessman]], [[Entrepreneur]] |years_active = 2011-present |known_for = [[Venera Cosmetics]]
Tendrik Ltd
[[Junior Chamber International|JSI]] Bulgaria |party = |spouse = |partner = |children = |mother = |relatives = |networth = }} '''Petar Dyaksov''' is a [[Bulgaria]]n [[entrepreneur]] and in [[digital marketing]] specialist.{{cite web | title = Петър Дяксов за новите правила на ЕК за онлайн пазаруване | url = https://www.bloombergtv.bg/video/petar-dyaksov-za-novite-pravila-na-ek-za-onlayn-pazaruvane | publisher = bloombergtv.bg | date = 16 November 2017 | language = Bulgarian}} He is founder and manager of the digital marketing agency Tendrik. Also, he is the founder and co-founder of different [[Electronic business|online businesses]] like fragrances.bg, timedix.bg, semando.com and others.{{cite web | title = Петър Дяксов: Бъдете двигател на промяната във вашия град | url = http://kafene.bg/%D0%BF%D0%B5%D1%82%D1%8A%D1%80-%D0%B4%D1%8F%D0%BA%D1%81%D0%BE%D0%B2-%D0%B1%D1%8A%D0%B4%D0%B5%D1%82%D0%B5-%D0%B4%D0%B2%D0%B8%D0%B3%D0%B0%D1%82%D0%B5%D0%BB-%D0%BD%D0%B0-%D0%BF%D1%80%D0%BE%D0%BC%D1%8F/ | publisher = kafene.bg | date = 15 February 2017 | language = Bulgarian}} ==Education== Born in [[Plovdiv]], Petar Dyaksov graduated his BA in "Business Management" at the [[University of Essex]] and later on acquired a Master's Degree in "International Business" at [[Aston University]] in England.{{cite web | title = Петър Дяксов: Ние сме тези, които можем да променим България към по-добро! | url = http://uspelite.bg/petar-dyaksov-nie-sme-tezi-koito-mojem-da-promenim-balgariya-kam-po-dobro-1 | publisher = uspelite.bg | date = 31 March 2016 | language = Bulgarian}} In 2013, he returned to Plovdiv and joined the international non-governmental youth organization for Bulgaria - [[Junior Chamber International|JCI (Junior Chamber International)]]. The organization’s aim is to unify young people between the ages of 18 and 40, all voluntarily! Also, the JCI organization helps realizing social activities, social initiatives, and events in Plovdiv. In the period of 2014-2015 he was the president of the local section JCI Plovdiv and in 2017 he became president of the national organization [[Junior Chamber International|JCI Bulgaria]].{{cite web | title = Петър Дяксов: Пловдив се прероди | url = http://www.kapana.bg/litza/item/6187-petar-dyaksov-plovdiv-se-prerodi | publisher = kapana.bg | date = 13 January 2017 | language = Bulgarian}} He participated in the realization and creation of various projects, among them are "The ten most prominent young people in Bulgaria" TOYP, "Getting Started in Business", "Book Box" and others. ==Business projects== ===fragrances.bg=== In 2011 he launches the [[Online shopping|online store]] for branded perfumes - fragrances.bg by the brand of [[Venera Cosmetics]]. In 2016 the management was taken over by Venera Commerce Ltd., whose’ manager is Petar Dyaksov. ===Tendrik=== {{Infobox company | name = Tendrik | logo = | logo_size = | type = [[Joint-stock company]] | foundation = 2015 | location = [[Plovdiv]], [[Bulgaria]] | owner = | key_people= Petar Dyaksov ([[chief executive officer|CEO]]) | area_served = | industry = digital and web agency | products= | revenue= | gross_income= | assets= | net_income= | num_employees= | subsid= | homepage=[https://tendrik.com/ Official website] | intl= }} In 2015 Dyaksov founded the digital and [[Advertising agency|web agency]] Tendrik (Tendrik Ltd).{{cite web | title = TENDRIK | url = https://www.lifehack.bg/author/tendrik/ | publisher = lifehack.bg}} Tendrik is an IT company offering the development of [[website]]s, [[Online shopping|online shops]], and designs, branding, and designing [[digital marketing]] strategies for all types of [[business]]es.{{cite web | title = Petar Dyaksov | url = https://www.lifehack.bg/author/dyaksov/ | publisher = lifehack.bg}} Tendrik (Tendrik Ltd.) is an IT company that offers all kinds of services related to online business. Its main activities: * Creating an online store; * Creating a corporate website; * Extensions for an online store; * Web design; * Digital marketing strategy; * SEO optimization; * Facebook advertising; * Google Ads; * Copywriting; * Social Network Marketing; * Video marketing. There are a number of clients in the company portfolio, both small and larger. Companies from different spheres and with a different range of activities. ===Semando Ltd.=== In 2018 he becomes co-founder of the online store for branded watches timedix.bg (Semando Ltd.) ==Trainings and seminars== Over the years Dyaksov was conducting different seminars and lectures.{{cite web | title = Информативен семинар на JSI България в Плевен | url = https://plevendnes.com/informativen-seminar-na-jci-bulgaria-v-pleven/ | publisher = plevendnes.com | date = 22 March 2017 | language = Bulgarian}} Some of the lectures, which he was leading were “How to create an amazing online store”, “10 steps of creating a successful online store”, “E-commerce training“, „How to be more effective and successful”, “and “SEO education for non-professionals”, “My first steps in business”{{cite web | title = "Първи стъпки в бизнеса" – безплатен семинар по предприемачество в Пловдив | url = http://www.plovdiv.utre.bg/2016/12/03/403258-purvi_stupki_v_biznesa_bezplaten_seminar_po_predpriemachestvo_v_plovdiv | publisher = plovdiv.utre.bg | date = 3 December 2016 | language = Bulgarian}} and others.{{cite web | title = Успешният онлайн бизнес. Съвети от Петър Дяксов | url = http://skill-ground.com/%D1%83%D1%81%D0%BF%D0%B5%D1%88%D0%BD%D0%B8%D1%8F%D1%82-%D0%BE%D0%BD%D0%BB%D0%B0%D0%B9%D0%BD-%D0%B1%D0%B8%D0%B7%D0%BD%D0%B5%D1%81-%D1%81%D1%8A%D0%B2%D0%B5%D1%82%D0%B8-%D0%BE%D1%82-%D0%BF%D0%B5%D1%82/ | publisher = skill-ground.com | date = 20 November 2016 | language = Bulgarian}} ==Books== Dyaksov is the co-author of the [[book]] for the world of branded [[perfume]]ry - „Тhe perfumes from A to Z” which was published in 2016 together with Hristina Dimitrova - a freelance writer in the sphere of international commerce, online marketing and copywriting.{{cite web | title = Как да изберем правилния парфюм | url = https://www.avtora.com/kak-da-izberem-pravilniia-parfium | publisher = avtora.com | date = 15 August 2017 | language = Bulgarian}} In the edition you can find many details and everything concerning the perfumery world, the history of the perfumes and technics of perfume production, as well as other questions regarding branded perfumes.{{cite web | title = Излезе първата безплатна българска книга, посветена на парфюмерийната индустрия | url = http://www.168chasa.bg/Article/5703484 | publisher = 168chasa.bg | date = 13 August 2016 | language = Bulgarian}} ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== *[http://dyaksov.com/ Official website] {{DEFAULTSORT:Dyaksov, Petar}} [[Category:1989 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Bulgarian businesspeople]] [[Category:Bulgarian company founders]] [[Category:Alumni of the University of Essex]] [[Category:Alumni of Aston University]] [[Category:People from Plovdiv]]

revision.text:
The '''Professional Science Master’s''' (PSM) Degree is a graduate degree designed to allow students to pursue advanced training in science or mathematics while simultaneously developing workplace skills. PSM programs are interdisciplinary in nature, preparing students for fields such as [[forensic science]], [[computational chemistry]], [[applied mathematics]] and [[bioinformatics]]. PSM degrees can be completed in sixteen months to two years of full-time study including an internship.
==History==
Recognizing that traditional graduate-level science training may not be suitable for non-academic careers, the [[Alfred P. Sloan Foundation]], in 1997, began to support master’s-level degree programs designed to provide science, technology, engineering, and mathematics ("STEM") students with a pathway into science-based careers.<ref name=Sloan2008>Alfred P. Sloan Foundation [Sloan], 2008</ref> These Professional Science Master’s degrees combine a science or mathematics curriculum with a professional component designed to provide graduates with the necessary skills for a career in business, government, or nonprofit agencies.<ref>Simms, 2006</ref>
Originally funding fourteen campuses, the Sloan Foundation expanded its support directly or indirectly to over fifty institutions, collectively offering over 100 different PSM programs.<ref name=Sloan2008/> As of 2017, there are 356 PSM programs at over 165 institutions. <ref>https://www.professionalsciencemasters.org/program-locator</ref> In 2005, the Foundation funded the Council of Graduate Schools to be an “institutional base for PSM growth, with the goal of making the degree a normal, recognized, widely accepted academic offering”.<ref name=Sloan2008/> In furtherance of this objective, the Sloan Foundation also provided support to found the National Professional Science Master’s Association, a professional organization of PSM directors and alumni intended to “provide a collective voice for PSM degree programs”.<ref>National Professional Science Master’s Association, 2010, para. 5</ref>
In 2007, Congress passed the [[America COMPETES Act]] which placed special emphasis on improving America’s economic competitiveness by strengthening STEM education. The COMPETES Act specifically mentioned the importance of the PSM degree to the nation’s overall competitiveness.<ref>CGS, 2007</ref> Additionally, a 2008 report issued by the [[United States National Research Council|National Research Council]] of the National Academies urged the continued expansion of the PSM degree. In 2009, the [[National Science Foundation]], under the auspices of the [[American Recovery and Reinvestment Act]], facilitated funding of twenty-two different PSM programs by appropriating funds for a Science Master’s program. ==References== {{reflist}}
==Bibliography== Alfred P. Sloan Foundation. (2008). Science Education: Professional Science Master’s Degree. Retrieved August 3, 2010, from http://www.sloan.org/program/15.
______________________. (2008). Professional Science Master’s Degree: History. Retrieved August 3, 2010, from http://www.sloan.org/program/15/page/67.
Committee on Enhancing the Master’s Degree in Natural Sciences. (2008). Science Professionals: Master’s Education for a Competitive World. Washington, D.C.: National Research Council of the National Academies. Retrieved August 3, 2010, from http://www.nap.edu/catalog.php?record_id=12064.
Council of Graduate Schools. (2007). Statement on the America COMPETES Act. Retrieved August 3, 2010,from http://www.cgsnet.org/portals/0/pdf/GR_AmericaCOMPETES_0307.pdf.
National Science Foundation. (2009). Program Solicitation: Science Master’s Program. Retrieved August 3, 2010, from https://www.nsf.gov/pubs/2009/nsf09607/nsf09607.htm.
National Professional Science Master’s Association. (2010). About Us. Retrieved August 3, 2010, from http://www.npsma.org/mc/page.do?sitePageId=101812&orgId=npsma.
Simms, Leslie. (2006). Professional Master’s Education: A CGS Guide to Establishing Programs. Washington, D.C.: Council of Graduate Schools.
==External links== *[http://www.npsma.org National Professional Science Master’s Association] *[http://www.sciencemasters.com Science Masters] *[http://www.nash-psm.org National Association of System Heads PSM Project ]
{{DEFAULTSORT:Professional Science Master's (Psm) Degree Programs}} [[Category:Higher education in the United States]] [[Category:Business qualifications]]

revision.comment: Rescuing 3 sources and tagging 0 as dead. #IABot (v1.6.5)
revision.text:
{{Use dmy dates|date=April 2016}} {{Use New Zealand English|date=April 2016}} [[File:Ray Avery GNZM investiture.jpg|thumb|right|Avery (left), after his investiture as a [[Knight Grand Companion of the New Zealand Order of Merit]] by the governor-general, Sir [[Anand Satyanand]], in 2011]] '''Sir Raymond John Avery''' {{post-nominals|country=NZL|GNZM}} (born 1947<ref>"[http://www.radionz.co.nz/national/programmes/nights/audio/2451244/ray-avery Ray Avery]". Radio New Zealand. 2010.</ref>) is a pharmaceutical scientist, inventor, author and [[social entrepreneurship|social entrepreneur]] in [[Mount Eden]], [[Auckland]], New Zealand.
==Personal life== Avery was born in [[Kent]], England.<ref name=lessons>{{cite news |title=Lessons from mean streets of London |url= http://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/news/article.cfm?c_id=1&objectid=10890968 |newspaper=The New Zealand Herald |date=17 June 2013 |accessdate=25 October 2014}}</ref> After spending his childhood in orphanages and foster homes, he developed an interest in science at the age of 14 while living [[Homelessness|rough]] in London and finding warmth in public libraries.<ref name=nzawards>[http://www.nzawards.org.nz/AwardRecipients/NewZealanderbroftheYear/tabid/36008/Default.aspx New Zealander of the Year Awards] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120223212319/http://www.nzawards.org.nz/AwardRecipients/NewZealanderbroftheYear/tabid/36008/Default.aspx |date=23 February 2012 }}</ref> He now mentors young people, speaking regularly at schools and universities.<ref>[http://tvnz.co.nz/good-morning/inspiring-kiwis-ray-avery-3379511 Inspiring Kiwis: Ray Avery]. [[Television New Zealand]].</ref> He was later educated at [[Wye College]], a tertiary agricultural college in Kent.<ref name=determination/>
He settled in New Zealand in 1973 and became a New Zealand citizen within nine months.<ref>{{cite news |title=Great end to glorious Christmas |url= http://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/news/article.cfm?c_id=1&objectid=10697215 |newspaper=The New Zealand Herald |date=31 December 2010 |accessdate=25 October 2014}}</ref> In 2010, Avery published his autobiography ''Rebel with a Cause'', which charts his life from childhood in English orphanages and foster homes to knighthood.<ref name=lessons/><ref name=determination>"[http://www.scoop.co.nz/stories/CU1007/S00410/one-kiwis-determination-to-make-a-difference.htm One Kiwi's determination to make a difference]". ''Scoop''. 29 July 2010.</ref>
==Career== After graduating, Avery worked as an analyst in laboratories, in which he eventually took a shareholding.<ref name=determination/> After leaving Britain and settling in New Zealand, he was a founding member of the Department of Clinical Pharmacology at the [[University of Auckland School of Medicine]]. He was then the technical director of [[Douglas Pharmaceuticals]], where he developed and commercialised pharmaceutical and nutritional products.<ref name="Collins">{{cite news |title=NZ man aids millions with 15c water drip invention |first=Simon |last=Collins |url= http://www.nzherald.co.nz/poverty/news/article.cfm?c_id=286&objectid=8501056 |newspaper=The New Zealand Herald |date=1 December 2004 |accessdate=25 October 2014}}</ref>
As Technical Director of the [[Fred Hollows Foundation]], Avery designed and commissioned two state of the art [[intraocular lens]] manufacturing facilities in [[Asmara, Eritrea]] and [[Kathmandu, Nepal]], and developed novel low cost lens manufacturing technologies, systems, and global distribution networks. The Fred Hollows Foundation laboratories now provide 13% of the world market for intraocular lenses and use technology invented and gifted by Avery.<ref>"[http://www.committeeforauckland.co.nz/component/content/article/8-news-and-publications/200-no-respect-for-the-status-quo No respect for the status quo]". Committee for Auckland.</ref> The mass introduction of regulatory-approved low-cost high-quality Fred Hollows lenses collapsed the global price of lenses, making modern [[cataract surgery]] accessible to the world's poorest.
In 2003, Avery founded the international development organisation [[Medicine Mondiale]] dedicated to making quality healthcare and equipment accessible to even the poorest developing nations around the world.<ref>"[http://www.medicinemondiale.org/about-us.html About Medicine Mondiale]". Medicine Mondiale.</ref>
In 2009, Avery received a World Class New Zealand Award <ref>[http://www.keanewzealand.com/global/2009-winners World Class New Zealand 2009 Winners] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130227095927/http://www.keanewzealand.com/global/2009-winners |date=27 February 2013 }}. Kea New Zealand.</ref> in the Life Sciences category.
Sir Ray is co–founder of Jupl NZ Ltd, a medical technology company.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://jupl.com/team/|title=Expertise, leadership and experience|publisher=Jupl|accessdate=10 December 2016}}</ref>
==Inventions== Avery’s inventions include:<ref>[http://idealog.co.nz/magazine/12/poor-fortune Poor fortune :: Idealog] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120209224755/http://idealog.co.nz/magazine/12/poor-fortune |date=9 February 2012 }}</ref> * [[Acuset IV Flow Controller]]: A device that facilitates the safe administration of potent [[IV drugs]].<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.medicinemondiale.org/PROJECTS/Acuset+IV+Flow+Controller.html |title=Acuset IV Flow Controller |publisher=Medicine Mondiale |accessdate=25 October 2014}}</ref> * Lifepod infant incubator: A high-tech low-cost [[Neonatal intensive care unit#Incubator|incubator]] that uses patentable technology to reduce the mortality rates associated with upper respiratory tract infections of premature babies.<ref name="Infant incubator">{{cite web |url= http://www.medicinemondiale.org/PROJECTS/Infant+Incubator.html |title=Infant incubator |publisher=Medicine Mondiale |accessdate=25 October 2014}}</ref> * Amino Natural: An [[amino acid]] based [[functional food]] used for the treatment and prevention of [[protein-energy malnutrition]].<ref name="Infant nutrition">{{cite web |url= http://www.medicinemondiale.org/PROJECTS/Infant+Nutrition.html |title=Infant nutrition |publisher=Medicine Mondiale |accessdate=25 October 2014}}</ref>
==Medicine Mondiale==
'''Medicine Mondiale''' is an independent development agency headed by Ray Avery focused on improving life for the world's poor by developing products and technologies that have applications in both the developing and developed world markets.
== Projects ==
=== Intraocular lenses ===
Between 1993 and 1997 Ray Avery designed and commissioned two state-of-the-art [[intraocular lens]] laboratories in [[Eritrea]] and in [[Nepal]]. Together these labs now supply 10% of the world market for intraocular lenses and together with the efforts of other generic lens manufacturers have collapsed the price of lenses from over US$300 in 1992 to around US$6 today. As a result, [[cataract]] surgery is now available to the very poorest around the world.
=== Acuset IV flow controller ===
The Acuset is a small device designed to control the flow of drugs through an [[intravenous therapy|intravenous (IV) drip]]. Unlike roller-clamp device still commonly used in the developing world, the Acuset is intuitive to use, even by untrained operators. It allows fine control and precision of flow rates, eliminating the accidental harm, and in some cases death, caused by incorrect drug doses.<ref name="Collins"/> In 2008 the Acuset was a finalist in the Saatchi & Saatchi World Changing Ideas Awards.<ref>{{cite web |url= http://saatchi.com/en-us/news/world_changing_ideas_award_finalists_announced/ |title=World Changing Ideas award finalists announced |date=22 January 2008 |work= |publisher=[[Saatchi & Saatchi]] |accessdate=25 October 2014}}</ref>
=== Infant nutrition ===
Medicine Mondiale has developed a range of nutritional productions for the treatment of protein-energy [[malnutrition]].<ref name=Maternova>{{cite web |url= http://maternova.org/health-innovations/proteinforte-predigested-protein-formulations |title=Proteinforte predigested protein formulations |date=6 August 2014 |publisher=Maternova |accessdate=25 October 2014}}</ref> These are designed to combat acute [[diarrhoea]], which is the leading cause of death in infants under two years of age in the developing world.<ref name="Infant nutrition"/>
=== Infant incubator ===
The Lifepod infant incubator is a low cost but high end [[Incubator (neonatal)|incubator]] invented by Sir Ray Avery.<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.hgfoundation.co.nz/Who+We+Support/Medical+Research++Innovation/Medicine+Mondiale.html |title=Medicine Mondiale |publisher=Hugh Green Foundation |accessdate=25 October 2014}}</ref> The incubator is designed around performance, ease of use and simple maintenance in challenging conditions, such as in poorly resourced healthcare facilities with inconsistent power and water supplies.
Much of the incubator's features have been designed in response to shortcomings in many current incubator designs, which are not always effective or practical in challenging conditions.
By combining an innovative microbial filtration system, as well as robust electronics and mechanisms, Medicine Mondiale intend for the Liferaft infant incubator to be a 'plug and play' solution for neonatal healthcare facilities, requiring little or no maintenance.<ref name="Infant incubator"/>
==Books== Avery has published two books: the best-selling Autobiography “Rebel with a Cause” <ref>"[http://penguin.co.nz/books/rebel-with-a-cause-9781869793913 Rebel with a Cause]" Penguin Books</ref> charting his life from street kid to Knighthood and “The Power of Us” <ref>"[http://beattiesbookblog.blogspot.co.nz/2012/11/the-power-of-us.html The Power of Us] Beattie's Book Blog</ref> celebrating New Zealanders who dare to dream.
==Honours== Avery has received awards including:
{| class="wikitable" |- ! Year !! Award !! Notes |- | | 2008 || [[Rotary International|Rotary]] Paul Harris Medal || |- | | 2008 || [[Bayer]] Research and Development Innovator Award || Acuset flow controller |- | | 2009 || World Class New Zealand Award for Biotechnology || |- | | 2010 || [[TBWA]] Disruption Award || |- | | 2010 || [[KiwiBank]] [[New Zealander of the Year Awards|New Zealander of the Year]]<ref name=nzawards /> || For designing technology used to produce low-cost intraocular lenses |- | | 2010 || [[Peter Blake (sailor)|Sir Peter Blake]] Leadership Medal<ref>[http://www.sirpeterblaketrust.org/leadership/awards/2010_awards/#Ray-Avery Sir Ray Avery]. Sir Peter Blake Trust.</ref> || |- | | 2011 || [[Ernst and Young]] Social Entrepreneur Award || |- align="left" | | 2011 || [[Readers Digest]] New Zealand's Most Trusted Person || |- | | [[2011 New Year Honours (New Zealand)|2011]] || Knight Grand Companion of the [[New Zealand Order of Merit]]<ref>{{cite web | url=https://www.dpmc.govt.nz/publications/new-year-honours-list-2011 | title=New Year honours list 2011 |date=31 December 2010| publisher=Department of the Prime Minister and Cabinet | accessdate=5 January 2018}}</ref> || For his services to philanthropy |}
==References== {{Reflist|30em}}
==External links== * [http://www.medicinemondiale.org/ Medicine Mondiale Official Website] * [http://medicinemondiale.wordpress.com/ Medicine Mondiale Official Blog]

revision.comment: Rescuing 2 sources and tagging 0 as dead. #IABot (v2.0beta9)
revision.text:
'''Ray R. Irani''' (born January 13, 1935)<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.nndb.com/people/588/000126210/|title=Ray R. Irani|publisher=[[NNDB]]|accessdate=21 September 2016}}</ref> is the former chairman and [[chief executive officer]] of [[Occidental Petroleum]]. He has worked at Occidental Petroleum for over 20 years, serving as a director since 1984, [[chief operating officer]] (president) from 1984 to 1990, and chairman and chief executive officer from 1990. During his early years, he worked with notable Occidental CEO [[Armand Hammer]], who at age 91, named Irani his successor in February 1990.<ref>Michael Lev, [https://select.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=F30612FA34580C758DDDAB0894D8494D81&showabstract=1 Hammer, 91, Gets an Heir At Occidental], ''The New York Times'', February 16, 1990.</ref> According to Forbes.com, his five-year total compensation between 2001 and 2005 was $127,447,000.<ref>[https://www.forbes.com/static/pvp2005/LIRWJ7X.html Executive Pay: Ray R. Irani], Forbes.com, 2005.</ref> In 2006, after a rise in oil prices, Irani earned a total of $460 million.<ref name="LAT040707">Elizabeth Douglass, [http://www.latimes.com/business/la-fi-irani7apr07,1,1196907.story Occidental CEO's 2006 paycheck: $560 million], ''Los Angeles Times'', April 7, 2007.</ref>
==Personal life== Irani was born in [[Lebanon]] and is of Palestinian origin. He received a [[bachelor of science]] degree in chemistry at the [[American University of Beirut]] in 1953. He moved in the same year to [[Los Angeles, California]], and at age 18, began graduate studies in physical chemistry at the [[University of Southern California]]. He received his [[PhD]] in 1957.<ref name="USC01">Eva Emerson, [http://www.usc.edu/schools/college/news/february_2007/irani.html Life Sciences Building Named in Honor of Alumnus] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20070219013558/http://www.usc.edu/schools/college/news/february_2007/irani.html |date=2007-02-19 }}, USC College News, February 2007.</ref> He subsequently worked as a researcher for the [[Monsanto Company]] until 1967 and joined the Shamrock Corporation. Prior to working for Occidental, he was president and chief operating officer of [[Olin Corporation]], a chemicals and metals company.
Irani is an honorary fellow of the [[American Institute of Chemists]] and is a member of the [[Council on Foreign Relations]]. He is currently a trustee of USC and co-chair of the board of Trustees of the American University of Beirut. USC named a primary life sciences building as Ray R. Irani Hall on February 9, 2007.<ref name="USC01"/> In February 2012, Irani, was elected as a member of the National Academy of Engineering. He was recognized "for leadership in the petrochemical industry and processes for applications of particulate systems." This is considered the highest honor in engineering in the United States.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.aub.edu.lb/news/2012/Pages/irani-nae.aspx |title=AUB trustee and alum Ray Irani elected to prestigious US engineering academy |date=2012-02-24 |accessdate=2013-01-29}}</ref>
==Career at Occidental== Irani was brought to Occidental in 1983 to help its struggling chemicals division, and soon was promoted to president, replacing a series of presidents fired by Hammer.<ref>John Evan Frook, [http://www.encyclopedia.com/doc/1G1-9111635.html New heir apparent at Occidental doesn't pacify unhappy shareholders, analysts say], Los Angeles Business Journal, February 4, 1990.</ref> By 1988, the media reported that Irani and his team were running the day-to-day operations of the company on behalf of the then 90-year-old Hammer.<ref>Anthony Ramirez, "Hammer Hits 90! Oxy Grows Up Too," ''Fortune'', November 7, 1988, p. 59.</ref> In 2008 Irani was awarded options worth $392 million.{{citation needed|date=October 2011}}
Irani made news in 2007, when it was revealed that his total compensation for the 2006 year topped $450 million. His base salary was $1.3 million. Occidental justified the compensation by pointing to the stock price, which had risen from $9 a share when Irani succeeded Hammer to $48.60 at the end of 2006, and to the company's market capitalization, which grew from $32.1 billion at the end of 2005 to $42.5 billion at the end of 2006.<ref name="LAT040707"/> His compensation in 2009 totaled $31.4 million, including $1,170,000 in salary and $24,758,827 in stock. According to the Associated Press, within the last decade, Irani has received $857 million.<ref>{{Citation |url=https://blogs.wsj.com/deals/2010/08/03/is-occidentals-irani-worth-his-big-pay-check/ | accessdate = 2011-10-04 | work=The Wall Street Journal | first=Michael | last=Corkery | title=Is Occidental's Irani Worth His Big Pay Check? | date=August 3, 2010}}</ref>
Irani put funds into an overseas tax shelter arranged by Deutsche Bank AG that the IRS later deemed an illegal [[tax avoidance]] scheme. The Occidental Chairman opposed the U.S. Department of Justice subpoena of Deutsche Bank AG records as part of an investigation of myCFO Inc. His appeal was rejected by the U.S. Court of Appeals in 2006. Occidental's Board of Directors took no action against Irani despite the IRS ruling. An Occidental spokesman said that Irani's participation in the tax avoidance scheme was a personal matter and was not a violation of the company's code of conduct policy.<ref>Peter Waldman [https://www.bloomberg.com/apps/news?pid=newsarchive&sid=aQgudxxo2XFQ Ray Irani Making $59 Millions As Americans Deplore Executive Pay March 25, 2010]</ref>
Irani was awarded a $900,000 cash bonus by the Occidental board of directors for exceptional performance in implementing a cost-cutting initiative (including reduction in force job terminations) in anticipation of a "world-wide economic deterioration." This was awarded on a discretionary basis by the Occidental compensation committee and not by any company performance metrics.<ref>{{Citation|url=http://www.thecorporatelibrary.com |title=The Corporate Library |website=thecorporatelibrary.com |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110917020547/http://thecorporatelibrary.com/ |archivedate=2011-09-17 |df= }}</ref> Chazen collected $38,080,344 and Irani $76,107,010 in fiscal year 2010, nearly doubling his 2009 compensation despite shareholder outrage over the Occidental board of directors executive pay policies.<ref>{{Citation|url=http://newsandinsight.thomsonreuters.com/Legal/News/ViewNews.aspx?id=22515|title=Woman tops list of highest-paid general counsels |accessdate=2011-09-11 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120401070457/http://newsandinsight.thomsonreuters.com/Legal/News/ViewNews.aspx?id=22515 |archivedate=2012-04-01 |df= }}</ref><ref>http://investing.businessweek.com/businessweek/research/stocks/people/person.asp?personId=293288&ticker= Executive Profile September 08, 2011 {{Dead link|date=September 2016}}</ref>
Irani retired as CEO on May 10, 2011 after the California State Teachers' Retirement System and Relational Investors, two major institutional Occidental Investors, objected to the company's compensation policies and announced plans to replace long-term board members who were described as "ossified" in a letter written in protest of Irani's salary. They also termed Irani's salary a "corporate giveaway program."<ref>{{cite web|url=https://dealbook.nytimes.com/tag/relational-investors/|title=Relational Investors - DealBook - The New York Times|publisher= dealbook.nytimes.com |accessdate=21 September 2016}}</ref>
Irani's salary was considered excessive and not truly performance based for decades by a number of corporate governance authorities who noted that Irani's compensation had exceeded that of the head of energy giant ExxonMobil, Rex Tillerson, who leads a company that has a market cap that is five times larger than Occidental Petroleum.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://articles.latimes.com/2010/aug/03/business/la-fi-oxy-calstrs-20100803|title=CalSTRS seeks to unseat 4 Oxy directors over executive pay|first=Marc|last=Lifsher|date=3 August 2010|publisher=[[Los Angeles Times]]|accessdate=21 September 2016}}</ref>
In 2010, former CFO and later President [[Stephen Chazen]] was named CEO of Occidental to replace Irani,<ref name="lamag.com">{{cite web|url=http://www.lamag.com/citythinkblog/well-paid/|title=Well Paid - Los Angeles Magazine|date=2 December 2010|publisher=lamag.com|accessdate=21 September 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2010-10-14/occidental-s-irani-highest-paid-oil-chief-executive-to-step-down-in-may|title=Occidental's Irani, Highest-Paid Oil CEO, to Retire|first=Joe|last=Carroll|date=14 October 2010|publisher=bloomberg.com|accessdate=21 September 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.sandiegouniontribune.com/sdut-oxy-petes-highly-paid-ceo-irani-to-step-down-2010oct14-story.html|title=Oxy Pete's highly paid CEO Irani to step down|first=Associated|last=Press|publisher=sandiegouniontribune.com|accessdate=21 September 2016}}</ref> who planned to stay on as executive Chairman until 2014.{{citation needed|date=September 2016}}
Irani was removed from the board of directors of Occidental on May 3, 2013.<ref>{{cite news| url=http://articles.latimes.com/2013/may/03/business/la-fi-mo-occidental-petroleum-chairman-steps-down-20130503|title=Occidental Petroleum Chairman Ray Irani ousted by shareholders|work=Los Angeles Times | first=Shan | last=Li | date=May 3, 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2013-05-03/occidental-s-irani-out-as-investor-revolt-ends-rule|title=Occidental's Irani Out as Investor Revolt Ends Rule|first=Bradley|last=Olson|date=3 May 2013|publisher=bloomberg.com|accessdate=21 September 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.labusinessjournal.com/news/2013/may/03/irani-forced-oxy-board/|title=Irani Forced Off Oxy Board - Los Angeles Business Journal|publisher=labusinessjournal.com|accessdate=21 September 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2013/05/04/business/occidental-chairman-irani-agrees-to-leave-company.html|title=Occidental Chairman Agrees to Step Down Ahead of Schedule|date=4 May 2013|work=The New York Times|accessdate=21 September 2016}}</ref>
==KB Home backdating scandal== Irani was a [[KB Home]] director for 15 years until November 2007.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://articles.latimes.com/2007/nov/03/business/fi-briefs3.s4|title=Occidental's Irani leaves KB board|first1=From Times|last1=Staff|first2=Wire|last2=Reports|date=3 November 2007|publisher=[[Los Angeles Times]]|accessdate=21 September 2016}}</ref> Irani chaired the KB Home executive compensation committee during the time period when CEO [[Bruce Karatz]] lied about the company's practice of backdating options. Karatz was subsequently indicted and convicted April 21, 2010 on Federal charges stemming from his actions and sanctioned by the SEC in a separate civil action. The KB Home shareholders expressed their lack of confidence in the board and the compensation committee by a 19% opposition vote against Irani, who resigned from the KB Home board of directors after 15 years of service. Occidental offered no explanation for his resignation in their proxy statement.<ref>{{Citation |url=http://www.businessweek.com/the_thread/hotproperty/archives/2009/03/former_kb_home_chief_indicted.html |archive-date= September 15, 2011 |deadurl=yes |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110915171415/http://www.businessweek.com/the_thread/hotproperty/archives/2009/03/former_kb_home_chief_indicted.html|title=Former KB Home Chief Indicted| date=April 5, 2007}}</ref><ref>{{Citation |url=http://www.plansponsor.com/NewsStory.aspx?id=6442451733 |title=CalPERS to Withhold Director Votes on Backdating Concerns |accessdate=2011-10-07 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120405081216/http://www.plansponsor.com/NewsStory.aspx?id=6442451733 |archive-date=2012-04-05 |dead-url=yes |df= }}</ref><ref>{{Citation |url=http://www.plansponsor.com/NewsStory.aspx?Id=6442451659 |title=KB Home Taps Independent Chairman in Post-Options Scandal Era |accessdate=2011-10-08 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120405081224/http://www.plansponsor.com/NewsStory.aspx?Id=6442451659 |archive-date=2012-04-05 |dead-url=yes |df= }}</ref>
==References== {{reflist|2}}
==External links== *[http://www.businessweek.com/bw50/2005/executive/OXY.htm Biography] from Businessweek.com. *[https://web.archive.org/web/20070510053622/http://www.arab-american-affairs.net/archives/houseLebanon-chagoury.htm House of Lebanon’s Ray R. Irani ‘Pride of Heritage’ Award]

revision.text:
{{Infobox person | name = Reza Zarrab | image = | image_size = | caption = | birth_name = Reza Zarrab | birth_date = {{birth date and age|df=yes|1983|9|12}} | birth_place = [[Tabriz]], [[Iran]] | citizenship = [[Iran]]{{cite news|title=Turkish National Arrested for Conspiring to Evade U.S. Sanctions Against Iran, Money Laundering and Bank Fraud|url=https://www.justice.gov/opa/pr/turkish-national-arrested-conspiring-evade-us-sanctions-against-iran-money-laundering-and|access-date=22 March 2016|work=US Department of Justice|date=21 March 2016}}
[[Azerbaijan]]
[[Turkey]]{{cite news ||first=Humeyra |last=Pamuk| url=https://www.reuters.com/article/2014/04/29/us-iran-turkey-special-report-idUSBREA3S07120140429| title=Special Report – Golden Loophole: How an alleged Turkish crime ring helped Iran| date=29 April 2014|agency=[[Reuters]]|access-date=29 April 2014}}
[[Republic of Macedonia|Macedonia]] | residence = [[Istanbul]], [[Turkey]] | alma_mater = | years_active = 2004–present | spouse = {{marriage|[[Ebru Gündeş]]|2010}} | children = 1 | website = | footnotes = | signature = }} '''Reza Zarrab''' ({{lang-fa|رضا ضراب}}, {{lang-tr|Rıza Sarraf}};{{cite web|url=http://www.haberturk.com/gundem/haber/904978-29-yasindaki-reza-zarrabin-hikayesi |title=Yolsuzluk operasyonu, Reza Zarrab kimdir|work=Haberturk.com |date=19 December 2013|access-date=23 March 2014}} born 12 September 1983 in [[Tabriz]], [[Iran]]) is a Turkey-based businessman. He has quadruple [[Iran]]ian, [[Azerbaijan]]i, [[Turkey|Turkish]] and [[Republic of Macedonia|Macedonian]] citizenship.{{cite news |title=Turkey corruption allegations included in Reza Zarrab case in US |author= |url=http://www.hurriyetdailynews.com/turkey-corruption-allegations-included-in-reza-zarrab-case-in-us.aspx?PageID=238&NID=99684&NewsCatID=509 |newspaper=[[Hürriyet Daily News]] |date=26 May 2016 |access-date=28 May 2016}}{{cite web|url=https://www.turkishminute.com/2016/06/16/ny-court-denies-bail-iranian-mogul-zarrab-announces-us-attorney-bharara/|title=NY court denies bail for Iranian mogul Zarrab, announces US Attorney Bharara – Turkish Minute|first=|last=TM|website=www.TurkisMminute.com|access-date=3 November 2017}} On 19 March 2016 he was arrested in the [[United States]],{{Cite web|url=https://www.justice.gov/opa/pr/turkish-national-arrested-conspiring-evade-us-sanctions-against-iran-money-laundering-and|title=Turkish National Arrested for Conspiring to Evade U.S. Sanctions Against Iran, Money Laundering and Bank Fraud|website=www.justice.gov|language=en|access-date=2017-11-30}} and is accused of being a member of international criminal organization. He was charged with evading the US [[economic sanctions]] on Iran and [[money laundering]] in an alleged [[racket (crime)|racket]] scheme to help Iran bypass the sanctions, involving ministers of the Turkish government of then prime minister and now president of Turkey, [[Recep Tayyip Erdoğan]].{{cite news|title=Is corruption suspect's US arrest bad news for Erdogan?|url=http://www.al-monitor.com/pulse/originals/2016/03/turkey-iran-usa-arrest-of-zarrab-bad-news-for-erdogan.html|work=Al-Monitor|date=23 March 2016|accessdate=2016-11-06}}{{cite news|title=Iran’s Turkish connection: Golden squeal: Did officials help evade sanctions?|url=https://www.economist.com/news/europe/21700422-did-officials-help-evade-sanctions-golden-squeal|work=[[The Economist]]|date=11 June 2016|accessdate=2016-11-06}} His father, Hossein Zarrab, had a close relationship with [[Mahmoud Ahmadinejad]],{{cite web|url=https://www.al-monitor.com/pulse/originals/2016/05/iran-babak-zanjani-reza-zarrab-corruption-cases.html|title=The downfall of two Iranian tycoons|first=|last=mshabani|date=9 May 2016|website=al-monitor.com|accessdate=3 November 2017|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20171020191142/https://www.al-monitor.com/pulse/originals/2016/05/iran-babak-zanjani-reza-zarrab-corruption-cases.html#|archive-date=2017-10-20|dead-url=yes|df=}} who served as the [[President of Iran]] between 2005 and 2013. The U.S. Department of Treasury accused Hossein Zarrab of violating U.S. sanctions on Iran and slapped a $9.1 million fine against him. His fine reduced to $2.3 million following his colloboration with the U.S. officials.{{cite web|url=http://www.hurriyet.com.tr/yazarlar/tolga-tanis/zarrabi-kim-tc-vatandasi-yapti-40113274|title=Zarrab’ı kim TC vatandaşı yaptı|website=hurriyet.com.tr|accessdate=3 November 2017}} Zarrab was arrested by the [[Federal Bureau of Investigation|FBI]] in Miami in the US on March 19, 2016 and was accused of bank fraud, money laundering and helping the Iranian government in evading the US economic sanctions on Iran to hinder its nuclear-weapons program. His charges; conspiracy to defraud, violating the [[International Emergency Economic Powers Act]], money laundering, and bank fraud; could bring up to 70 years in prison if found guilty in the U.S. Federal Court.{{cite web|url=https://www.justice.gov/opa/pr/turkish-national-arrested-conspiring-evade-us-sanctions-against-iran-money-laundering-and|title=Turkish National Arrested for Conspiring to Evade U.S. Sanctions Against Iran, Money Laundering and Bank Fraud|website=www.justice.gov|accessdate=3 November 2017}} ==Early life== Zarrab was born in Tabriz to [[Iranian Azerbaijani]] parents{{cite news | url=http://iranwire.com/fa/projects/4057 | title=حاشیه‌های بازداشت تاجر ایرانی در ترکیه؛ از بابک زنجانی تا مشایی | date=2013-12-18 | agency=Iran Wire | accessdate=2013-12-18}} and grew up in [[Azerbaijan]] and [[Turkey]]. Reza Zarrab became a dual citizen of [[Turkey]] and the [[Republic of Azerbaijan]] after settling in [[Istanbul]].{{cite news | url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/persian/iran/2013/12/131218_l10_reza_zarrab_turkey.shtml | title=ایرانی بازداشت شده در ترکیه 'در مورد دور زدن تحریم‌ها بازجویی شده بود'| date=2013-12-18 | agency=[[BBC Persian]] | accessdate=2013-12-18}} Zarrab's parents remained in Baku through 2010–11; in 2013 they were granted Turkish citizenship reportedly through facilitation of then Interior Minister Muammer Güler. {{cite news|url=http://www.todayszaman.com/national_zarrabs-father-given-citizenship-via-exceptional-status_369768.html |title=Zarrab’s father given citizenship via ’exceptional status’ |date=2015-01-14 |agency=[[Zaman Daily News]] |accessdate=2016-03-22 |deadurl=bot: unknown |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160305082033/http://www.todayszaman.com/national_zarrabs-father-given-citizenship-via-exceptional-status_369768.html |archivedate=2016-03-05 |df= }} In 2008, Reza Zarrab married to a Turkish pop star, [[Ebru Gündeş]] and had a child in 2011.{{cite web|url=http://www.iha.com.tr/haber-reza-zarrab-kimdir-reza-zarrabin-hayati-ebru-gundesin-esi-reza-zarrab-317902/|title=Reza Zarrab kimdir? Reza Zarrab'ın hayatı. Ebru Gündeş'in eşi Reza Zarrab|website=iha.com.tr|accessdate=3 November 2017}} He started his business life in Turkey in 2008 with the company named Royal Maritime A.S. He founded Royal Holding with his brother Mohammed Zarrab (Can Sarraf) in 2010.http://royalholding.com.tr/index.php?royalholding=hakkimizda{{dead link|date=April 2018 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }} Zarrab’s chauffeur, Turgut Harpani, was arrested by the Turkish Customs Protection agency during his trip to Russia from Turkey in 2011 for carrying $150 millions in cash and was accused of conducting illegal money couriering, but he was then released by Turkish authorities.{{cite web|url=http://m.milliyet.com.tr/gundes-in-esinin-soforu-kacakciliktan-gozaltinda-magazin-1377987/|title=Gündeş’in eşinin şoförü kaçakçılıktan gözaltında – Magazin Haberleri|website=milliyet.com.tr|accessdate=3 November 2017}}{{cite web|url=http://m.haberturk.com/yasam/haber/620972-soforunde-150-milyon-dolar|title=Şoföründe 150 milyon dolar!|website=haberturk.com|accessdate=3 November 2017}} Happani shared his own pictures on Facebook with suitcases full of money. {{cite web|url=http://m.radikal.com.tr/turkiye/operasyonu_baslatan_fotograf_balya_balya_dolar-1166808/|title=Operasyonu başlatan fotoğraf: Facebook'ta balya balya dolar! – Türkiye Haberleri – Radikal|first=|last=Radikal|website=radikal.com.tr|accessdate=3 November 2017}} The Turkish National Intelligence Agency (MIT) urged then Prime Minister Erdoğan in April 2013 about Zarrab’s corrupted relations with the Turkish cabinet members.{{cite web|url=http://birgun.net/haber/mitten-erdogana-sarraf-raporu-12357.html|title=MİT'ten Erdoğan'a Sarraf raporu – BirGün.net – Halkın Gazetesi BirGün|date=19 March 2014|website=archive.org|accessdate=3 November 2017|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140319222958/http://birgun.net/haber/mitten-erdogana-sarraf-raporu-12357.html|archivedate=19 March 2014|df=}} Zarrab received an “exceptional citizenship” and became a Turkish citizen with the decision given by the Turkish Council of Ministers on June 1, 2007. He was accused of bribing $1.5 million to receive Turkish Citizenship in the indictment.{{cite web|url=http://m.milliyet.com.tr/5-milyon-dolara-turk-vatandasi/gundem/detay/1809571/default.htm|title=5 milyon dolara Türk vatandaşı oldular – Son Dakika Haberler|website=milliyet.com.tr|accessdate=3 November 2017}} ==2013 corruption scandal in Turkey== {{main|2013 corruption scandal in Turkey}} Zarrab, who has a business affiliation with the Iranian billionaire and [[business magnate]] [[Babak Zanjani]], was detained in Istanbul on 17 December 2013 due to his involvement with the sons of three ministers ([[Erdoğan Bayraktar]], [[Muammer Güler]] and [[Zafer Çağlayan]]) in the [[Government of Turkey|Turkish government]] and [[Egemen Bağış]], the former minister for EU Affairs and Turkey's chief negotiator in accession talks with the [[European Union]],{{cite news | url=http://www.radikal.com.tr/turkiye/uc_bakana_rusvet_suclamasi-1166735 | title=Üç bakana rüşvet suçlaması | date=2013-12-18 | agency=Radikal | accessdate=2013-12-18 | archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20131219021159/http://www.radikal.com.tr/turkiye/uc_bakana_rusvet_suclamasi-1166735# | archive-date=2013-12-19 | dead-url=yes | df= }}{{cite news | url=http://t24.com.tr/haber/yolsuzluk-ve-rusvet-sorusturmasinda-egemen-bagis-goruntuleri-de-cikti/246398 | title=Yolsuzluk ve rüşvet soruşturmasında Egemen Bağış görüntüleri de çıktı! | date=2013-12-19 | agency=T24 | accessdate=2013-12-19}}{{cite news | url=https://www.nytimes.com/2013/10/05/world/middleeast/to-this-tycoon-iran-sanctions-are-like-gold.html?_r=0| title=To This Tycoon, Iran Sanctions Were Like Gold| date=2013-10-05 | agency=New York Times | accessdate=2013-10-05}} in an alleged [[bribery]], [[corruption]] and [[smuggling]] racket.{{cite web|url=http://www.hurriyet.com.tr/ekonomi/25378685.asp |title=İstanbul'da yolsuzluk ve rüşvet operasyonu |publisher=Hurriyet.com.tr |date= |accessdate=2014-03-23}} The court ordered his arrest on 21 December along with Barış Güler, son of Muammer Güler, and Kaan Çağlayan, son of Zafer Çağlayan.{{cite web|url=http://www.hurriyet.com.tr/gundem/25412674.asp |title=2 Bakan oğlu ile Reza Zarrab tutuklandı |publisher=Hurriyet.com.tr |date= |accessdate=2014-03-23}} He was released on 28 February 2014.{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-26387522 |title=Turkey frees cabinet ministers' sons |publisher=bbc.com |date= |accessdate=2014-08-17}} The investigation in Turkey revealed a system to help Iran bypass US sanctions against the country concerning the [[Society for Worldwide Interbank Financial Telecommunication|SWIFT]] payment system, in a scheme based on Turkish public bank [[Halkbank]], whereby money was transferred to front companies in [[China]] and Turkey, and [[gold]] bought with that money transferred to Iran via [[Dubai]]. Then Interior Minister [[Muammer Güler]]’s son, Barış Güler, then Economy Minister [[Zafer Çağlayan|Zafer Çaglayan]]’s son, Kaan Çaglayan, and General Director of Halk Bank, Suleyman Arslan, were among the suspects including Reza Zarrab. They were arrested due to accusations of “bribery, professional misconduct, bid rigging, and smuggling”.{{cite web|url=http://www.hurriyet.com.tr/amp/2-bakan-oglu-ile-reza-zarrab-tutuklandi-25412674|title=2 Bakan oğlu ile Reza Zarrab tutuklandı – Son Dakika Haberler|website=www.hurriyet.com.tr|accessdate=3 November 2017}}{{cite web|url=http://m.hurriyet.com.tr/uc-bakanin-oglu-gozaltinda-25378920|title=Üç bakanın oğlu gözaltında|website=hurriyet.com.tr|accessdate=3 November 2017}} Erdogan backlashed and announced the investigation as a “judicial coup” against his government, and dismissed the prosecutors and police officials investigating the corruption scheme. After a 70-day detainment, Zarrab and the sons of cabinet members were released from jail.{{cite web|url=http://www.hurriyet.com.tr/amp/reza-zarrab-ve-bakan-cocuklari-tahliye-edildi-25912625|title=Reza Zarrab ve Bakan çocukları tahliye edildi – Son Dakika Haberler|website=www.hurriyet.com.tr|accessdate=3 November 2017}} Erdogan received harsh criticism for obstructing and undermining justice and putting the judiciary under his executive authority. However, Erdogan announced that “justice has been served”.{{cite web|url=http://www.cumhuriyet.com.tr/amp/haber/siyaset/46077/Erdogan__Adalet_yerini_buldu.html|title=Erdoğan: Adalet yerini buldu|website=cumhuriyet.com.tr|accessdate=3 November 2017}} Egemen Bağış, then Minister of European Union Affairs, was dismissed after the corruption investigation. The Ministers of Interior Affairs, Economic Relations, and Environment and Urbanization – Muammer Güler, Zafer Çaglayan, and Erdoğan Bayraktar, respectively – had to resign from their positions.{{cite web|url=http://www.bbc.com/turkce/haberler/2014/12/141212_17_25_aralik_operasyonu_neler_oldu_10_soruda|title=10 soruda: 17–25 Aralık operasyonları|first=Mahmut Hamsici BBC|last=Türkçe|website=BBC Türkçe|accessdate=3 November 2017}} The indictment charged high-ranked officials with significant accusations for receiving bribes: Zafer Caglayan received $52 million worth of bribes; Muammer Guler received $10 million worth of bribes; and Egemen Bağış received $1.5 million worth of bribes.{{cite web|url=http://www.cumhuriyet.com.tr/amp/haber/turkiye/29997/Bagis__Caglayan_ve_Guler_kac_TL_rusvet_almakla_suclaniyor_.html|title=Bağış, Çağlayan ve Güler kaç TL rüşvet almakla suçlanıyor?|website=cumhuriyet.com.tr|accessdate=3 November 2017}} The summary of proceedings were sent to the Turkish parliament for the vote on whether to lift ministers’ immunity and send them to court. However, given the strong majority of Erdoğan's ruling party (AKP), in January 2015 the parliament did not lift their immunity and swept away the significant investigation.{{cite web|url=http://www.cumhuriyet.com.tr/amp/haber/turkiye/191219/AKP_li_vekiller_4_eski_bakan_icin_vicdanlarini_sifirladilar.html|title=AKP'li vekiller 4 eski bakan için vicdanlarını sıfırladılar|website=cumhuriyet.com.tr|accessdate=3 November 2017}} In May 2014, Erdoğan announced that he initiated a “witch-hunt” against the Gulen movement for, as he alleged, being behind the corruption investigation.{{cite web|url=http://m.t24.com.tr/amp/haber/erdogan-cadi-aviysa-biz-bu-cadi-avini-yapacagiz-bunu-da-bilin,258112|title=Erdoğan: Cadı avıysa, biz bu cadı avını yapacağız, bunu da bilin! – Gündem – T24|website=m.t24.com.tr|accessdate=3 November 2017}} Two months after this announcement, the government arrested and detained police officials who conducted the corruption investigation. The prosecutors of the corruption investigation were also dismissed from their positions.{{cite web|url=http://m.haberturk.com/gundem/haber-amp/1273102-17-25-aralikin-fetocu-polislerine-operasyon|title=17–25 Aralık'ın FETÖ'cü polislerine operasyon – Gündem Haberleri|website=m.haberturk.com|accessdate=3 November 2017}}{{cite web|url=http://m.mynet.com/1725-aralik-savcilarina-ihrac-guncel-1835160|title=1725 Aralık savcılarına ihraç|first=|last=Aljazeera|website=mynet.com|accessdate=3 November 2017}} While Erdoğan has alleged that Zarrab conducted trade and business in aligned with Turkish interests, there have been several reports that suggest Zarrab’s illegal activities extensively harmed the Turkish economy.https://washingtonhatti.com/2017/09/13/zarrab-caglayan-gercekten-ulke-cikarina-mi-calisti-ust-d +uzey-yo neticid en-perde-arkasi/ ==Arrest in the United States== On 19 March 2016, Zarrab was arrested in [[Miami]], Florida, for conspiring to evade [[U.S. sanctions against Iran]] (by using his gold business to help Iran’s government evade the sanctions), [[money laundering]] and [[bank fraud]]. He was later indicted by a grand jury with charges that could bring up to 75 years in prison.{{cite web|url=https://www.justice.gov/opa/pr/turkish-national-arrested-conspiring-evade-us-sanctions-against-iran-money-laundering-and|title=Turkish National Arrested for Conspiring to Evade U.S. Sanctions Against Iran, Money Laundering and Bank Fraud – OPA – Department of Justice|date=3 April 2016|website=archive.org|accessdate=3 November 2017|deadurl=bot: unknown|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160403002020/https://www.justice.gov/opa/pr/turkish-national-arrested-conspiring-evade-us-sanctions-against-iran-money-laundering-and|archivedate=3 April 2016|df=}}{{cite web|url=https://www.reuters.com/article/us-usa-iran-zarrab/u-s-arrests-turkish-businessman-for-scheme-to-evade-iran-sanctions-idUSKCN0WN295|title=U.S. arrests Turkish businessman accused of evading Iran sanctions|date=21 March 2016|publisher=|accessdate=3 November 2017|via=Reuters}} The case is being prosecuted by the U.S. Attorney for the [[United States District Court for the Southern District of New York|Southern District of New York]], led by [[Preet Bharara]], with assistance from a trial attorney of the National Security Division’s Counterintelligence and Export Control Section. During the case, prosecutors have noted that Zarrab donated $4.5 million to a charity founded by [[Emine Erdoğan]], the wife of former prime minister and now president of Turkey [[Recep Tayyip Erdoğan]]. Prosecutors stated that Zarrab has "close ties" to Erdoğan.{{cite news|title=US prosecutors say businessman with 'close ties' to Turkey's Erdogan poses flight risk|url=http://www.dw.com/en/us-prosecutors-say-businessman-with-close-ties-to-turkeys-erdogan-poses-flight-risk/a-19283437|work=Deutsche Welle|date=26 May 2016|accessdate=2016-11-06}} After Zarrab's arrest, shares in [[Halk Bankası|Halkbank]], whose CEO was among those charged with taking bribes from Zarrab, had fallen by 20%. He has offered to pay $50 million to be granted a [[bail]]. Bail has been denied. In their brief against granting bail, prosecutors had argued that "if the defendant were able to reach Turkish soil, he could cause the highest levels of Turkish government to block his return to the United States." In April 2017, media reported that negotiations involving the U.S. and Turkish governments were undergoing, to the effect that Zarrab would be extradited to Turkey while in return "Turkey would be much less resistant to the US’s missions in Syria, and primarily its support to the [[Democratic Union Party (Syria)|PYD]]."{{cite news|title=Rudy Giuliani, the jailed Turkish gold trader and the secret meeting with Erdogan |url=https://www.irishtimes.com/news/world/us/rudy-giuliani-the-jailed-turkish-gold-trader-and-the-secret-meeting-with-erdogan-1.3056527|publisher=The Irish Times|date=21 April 2017}} One of the most striking arguments in the indictment about Zarrab was that the Zarrab family sent a letter addressed to the president of Iran’s Central Bank and stated that he was ready for "Economic Jihad" against sanctions on Iran.{{cite web|url=https://www.occrp.org/en/azerbaijanilaundromat/notorious-laundromats-used-in-irans-anti-sanction-economic-jihad|title=Notorious Laundromats Used in Iran’s Anti-Sanction ‘Economic Jihad’ – OCCRP|first=Paul Radu and Khadija|last=Ismayilova|website=occrp.org|accessdate=3 November 2017}} Erdoğan's first comment on Zarrab’s arrest by the United States government was: “it was not a case that interests Turkey".{{cite web|url=http://www.ntv.com.tr/amp/turkiye/cumhurbaskani-erdogandan-riza-sarraf-aciklamasi,FGvKyWPapEWAqp0sNaMv4g|title=Cumhurbaşkanı Erdoğan'dan Rıza Sarraf açıklaması – NTV|website=www.ntv.com.tr|accessdate=3 November 2017}} However, it is claimed that Erdoğan, on September 21, 2016 during a special meeting with then Vice President [[Joe Biden]], requested Zarrab's release from jail and prosecutor Bharara to be dismissed from his position. Also, it is claimed that Erdogan’s wife, [[Emine Erdoğan|Emine Erdogan]], did a similar request to Biden’s wife, [[Jill Biden]]. Furthermore, [[Bekir Bozdağ|Bekir Bozdag]], the Turkish Minister of Justice, visited the [[United States Attorney General]] [[Loretta Lynch|Loretta E. Lynch]] in October 2016 and stated how the Zarrab case was unfounded and that Zarrab should be released{{cite web|url=http://www.cnn.com/videos/tv/2017/10/16/tl-preet-bharara-trukey-trump-jake-tapper.cnn|title=Bharara on whether Turkey pushed for his ouster – CNN Video|website=cnn.com|accessdate=3 November 2017}}https://www.washingtonpost.com/amphtml/opinions/global-opinions/the-man-at-the-crux-the-of-us-turkey-dispute-is-about-to-go-on-trial/2017/10/12/92c4c7a2-af96-11e7-be94-fabb0f1e9ffb_story.htm By the time, it came out that Zarrab's attorneys, [[Rudy Giuliani|Rudolph W. Giuliani,]] a former New York City mayor, and [[Michael Mukasey|Michael B. Mukasey]], who served as attorney general in President George W. Bush’s administration, held a secret meeting with Erdoğan.{{cite web|url=https://mobile.nytimes.com/2017/04/20/nyregion/rudy-giuliani-reza-zarrab-iran-sanctions-case.html?referer=https://www.google.com.ua/|title=Why Giuliani Held a Secret Meeting With Turkey’s Leader|website=mobile.nytimes.com|accessdate=3 November 2017}} Halkbank Deputy Chief Executive Mehmet Hakan Atilla, who was in connection with Zarrab, was arrested in the United States in March 2017 with the charges of "conspiring to evade US sanctions against Iran and other offenses”.{{cite web|url=https://www.justice.gov/usao-sdny/pr/turkish-banker-arrested-conspiring-evade-us-sanctions-against-iran-and-other-offenses|title=Turkish Banker Arrested For Conspiring To Evade U.S. Sanctions Against Iran And Other Offenses|website=www.justice.gov|accessdate=3 November 2017}} Afterwards, it was announced in September 2017 that the US charged then Turkish Minister of Economic Affairs [[Zafer Çağlayan|Zafer Caglayan]] and former General Manager of Halk Bank Suleyman Aslan with offenses similar to Zarrab's.{{cite web|url=https://washingtonhatti.com/2017/03/29/m-hakan-atilla-iddianamesinde-halkbanka-cok-agir-suclamalar-cikti/|title=M.Hakan Atilla Yakalama Kararında Halkbank'a Çok Ağır Suçlamalar Çıktı -|website=washingtonhatti.com|accessdate=3 November 2017}}{{cite web|url=https://www.justice.gov/usao-sdny/pr/former-turkish-minister-economy-former-general-manager-turkish-government-owned-bank|title=Former Turkish Minister Of The Economy, Former General Manager Of Turkish Government-Owned Bank, And Two Other Individuals Charged With Conspiring To Evade U.S. Sanctions Against Iran And Other Offenses|website=www.justice.gov|accessdate=3 November 2017}} Erdoğan appeared to be involved in the allegations about the US investigation. It was claimed that Erdogan's effort to save Zarrab was the fear that the inquiry had reached him.{{cite web|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2017/10/14/world/europe/turkey-new-york-case.html|title=Why a New York Court Case Has Rattled Turkey’s President|first1=Patrick|last1=Kingsley|first2=Benjamin|last2=Weiser|date=14 October 2017|publisher=|accessdate=3 November 2017|via=www.nytimes.com}} It is also alleged that Erdoğan wanted the US to release Zarrab in return for the detained US citizen pastor Andrew Brunson being held in a prison in Turkey.{{cite web|url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/democracy-post/wp/2017/07/07/why-trump-should-not-swap-prisoners-with-erdogan/|title=Opinion – Why Trump should not swap prisoners with Erdogan|website=Washington Post|accessdate=3 November 2017}} Metin Topuz, a Turkish employee of the US Consulate General in Istanbul, was arrested on October 4, 2017 for espionage, being a member of crime network, and taking the evidences of the 2013 corruption investigation to the US. In the arrest warrant, it is emphasized that the main suspects of the December 17th corruption investigation were “foreign intelligence agencies and countries{{cite web|url=http://gazete.netgazete.com/gazeteler.php?id=20|title=Takvim Gazetesi|website=gazete.netgazete.com|accessdate=3 November 2017}}” As a response to the arrest, the US Embassy in Turkey announced on October 8, 2017, that "visa applications from Turkey were suspended."{{cite web|url=http://www.bloomberght.com/haberler/haber/2055744-abd-vizeleri-askiya-aldi|title=ABD Türkiye'den vize başvurularını askıya aldı – Bloomberg HT|website=bloomberght.com|accessdate=3 November 2017}} On November 16, 2017, ''NBC News,'' reported that Zarrab is now cooperating with federal prosecutors in a [[Money laundering|money-laundering]] case and that he was then out of jail, a move President Erdoğan had been desperately hoping to avoid{{Cite news|url=https://www.nbcnews.com/news/us-news/does-cooperating-witness-have-info-flynn-tie-turkey-n821341|title=Does cooperating witness have info on Flynn tie to Turkey?|work=NBC News|access-date=2017-11-17|language=en}}. It is thought that Zarrab is [[Robert Mueller]]'s key to taking down Michael T. Flynn in the [[Special Counsel investigation (2017–present)|2017 Special Counsel Investigation]].{{Cite news|url=https://www.thedailybeast.com/did-the-feds-flip-turkish-businessman-reza-zarraband-could-he-bring-down-michael-flynn|title=Did the Feds Flip Turkish Businessman Reza Zarrab—and Could He Bring Down Michael Flynn?|last=Zavadski|first=Katie|date=2017-11-16|work=The Daily Beast|access-date=2017-11-17}}{{Cite web|url=https://www.rferl.org/a/turkish-iranian-businessman-zarrab-gold-trade-erdogan-ties-iran-sanctions-case-reported-cooperating-us-prosecutors/28859053.html|title=Man Accused In U.S. Iran Sanctions Case Reported Working With Prosecutors|website=RadioFreeEurope/RadioLiberty|access-date=2017-11-17}} In response to Zarrab's release from detention to another facility inside the United States, the Turkish government expressed concern as to the status of Zarrab.{{Cite news|url=https://www.al-monitor.com/pulse/originals/2017/11/turkey-demands-info-reza-zarrab.html|title=Turkey demands news as Zarrab drops off radar|last=kjenson|date=2017-11-16|work=Al-Monitor|access-date=2017-11-17|language=en-us|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6vOW5patk?url=https://www.al-monitor.com/pulse/originals/2017/11/turkey-demands-info-reza-zarrab.html|archivedate=2017-12-01|df=}} Two weeks later, Zarrab reappeared in Manhattan court as a witness in the case against Atilla, having accepted a plea deal with federal prosecutors.{{cite news|url=http://www.nbcnews.com/news/us-news/gold-trader-zarrab-will-be-star-witness-iran-sanction-busting-n824351|title=Gold trader Zarrab will be star witness in Iran sanction-busting trial|publisher=NBC News|date=28 November 2017}} A day after Zarrab testified in US Federal District Court, the Turkish government seized the assets of his and his family, including his wife Ebru Gündeş.{{cite web|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2017/12/01/world/europe/erdogan-turkey-iran-sanctions.html |title=Turkey Seizes Assets of Reza Zarrab, Witness in Sanctions-Evasion Case |author=Benjamin Weiser |date=1 December 2017 |website=[[NYTimes.com]] |access-date=4 December 2017}} ==Personal life== Zarrab is married to the Turkish singer [[Ebru Gündeş]]. They have one child together. Ebru Gündeş reportedly filed for divorce in September 2016,{{cite web|url=http://www.hurriyet.com.tr/son-dakika-haberi-ebru-gundes-ile-reza-zarrab-bosaniyor-40230898|title=Ebru Gündeş'ten 'boşanma' için ilk açıklama|language=Turkish|publisher=Hürriyet|date=25 September 2016|accessdate=8 September 2017}} but the couple reconciled shortly afterwards.{{cite web|url=http://www.hurriyet.com.tr/bosanma-davasinda-surpriz-gelisme-40314705|title=Reza Zarrab ile Ebru Gündeş'in boşanma davasında sürpriz gelişme|language=Turkish|publisher=Hürriyet|date=4 August 2017|accessdate=8 September 2017}} ==Export award== In June 2015, Zarrab received the Turkish Export Award jointly from the hands of [[Prime Minister of Turkey|Deputy Prime Minister]] [[Numan Kurtulmuş]], [[Ministry of Economy (Turkey)|Minister of Economy]] [[Nihat Zeybekçi]], and President of the Turkish Exporters Council Mehmet Büyükekşi, in a ceremony attended by President [[Recep Tayyip Erdoğan]].{{cite web|url=http://www.mashreghnews.ir/fa/news/432684/%D8%AF%D9%88%D9%84%D8%AA-%D8%AA%D8%B1%DA%A9%DB%8C%D9%87-%D8%A8%D9%87-%D8%B1%D8%B6%D8%A7-%D8%B6%D8%B1%D8%A7%D8%A8-%D8%AC%D8%A7%DB%8C%D8%B2%D9%87-%D8%AF%D8%A7%D8%AF-%D8%B9%DA%A9%D8%B3 |title=دولت ترکیه به رضا ضراب جایزه داد +عکس|publisher=[[Mashregh]] |date= |accessdate=2015-06-23}}{{cite news |title=Reza Zarrab'a ihracat ödülü |trans-title=Export award for Reza Zarrab |url=http://www.hurriyet.com.tr/reza-zarraba-ihracat-odulu-29344202 |newspaper=[[Hürriyet]] |date=22 June 2015 |accessdate=23 March 2016}} ==See also== * [[Babak Zanjani]], Iranian businessman ==References== {{Reflist|30em|refs= }} {{Authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Zarrab, Reza}} [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:1983 births]] [[Category:Gold investments]] [[Category:Iranian businesspeople]] [[Category:Iranian Azerbaijani businesspeople]] [[Category:People from Tabriz]] [[Category:Naturalized citizens of Turkey]] [[Category:Turkish people of Iranian descent]] [[Category:Turkish people of Azerbaijani descent]]

revision.text:
{{other people}} '''Harry Richard Black''' (October 10, 1921 – March 30, 2014) was an [[United States|American]] [[commercial artist]], [[illustrator]], and portraitist. Black created the original [[Mr. Clean]] [[mascot]] for [[Procter & Gamble]]'s household cleaner during the 1950s.<ref name=nytimes>{{cite news|first=Daniel E. |last=Slotnik |title=Richard Black, 92, Artist Who Conjured ‘Mr. Clean,’ Dies |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2014/04/03/business/richard-black-92-dies-first-illustrator-of-mr-clean.html?_r=0 |work=[[New York Times]] |publisher= |date=2014-04-02 |accessdate=2014-05-04}}</ref><ref name=ddn>{{cite news|first=Amelia|last=Robinson |title=Kettering man behind "Mr. Clean" and "Smokey Bear" has died |url=http://www.daytondailynews.com/news/lifestyles/kettering-man-behind-mr-clean-and-smokey-bear-has-/nfPW2/ |work=[[Dayton Daily News]] |publisher= |date=2014-04-01 |accessdate=2014-05-04}}</ref>
==Biography== ===Early life and education=== Richard Black was born on October 10, 1921, in [[Philadelphia]], [[Pennsylvania]].<ref name=nytimes/> He enrolled at Syracuse University, but left the school to enlist in the [[United States Army Air Corps|Army Air Corps]] during [[World War II]].<ref name=nytimes/> He moved to Ohio after the war and opened an art studio in [[Dayton, Ohio|Dayton]].<ref name=nytimes/> He also taught art at both the [[University of Dayton]] and [[Sinclair Community College]] on a part-time basis for years.<ref name=nytimes/>
===Career=== Black, who spent much of his career as a commercial artist, worked on projects for a number of companies, ranging from [[Frigidaire]] to [[Shell Oil]]. However, Black is best known for creating the widely recognized [[Mr. Clean]] commercial [[mascot]].<ref name=nytimes/> [[Procter & Gamble]] contacted Black during the 1950s. He was tasked by P&G with creating a new mascot for a forthcoming household cleaning product, to be called Mr. Clean. Executives at Procter & Gamble described the new cleaner as being "like [[Magic (paranormal)|magic]]" and envisioned the new product's mascot as a [[genie]] from a bottle.<ref name=nytimes/>
Procter & Gamble wanted Black to design a bald man (or genie) with a nose ring.<ref name=nytimes/> Black created two versions of the genie, one with a nose ring and one without the ring.<ref name=nytimes/> Procter & Gamble decided to use Black's image without the ring as Mr. Clean.<ref name=nytimes/> Mr. Clean products were first released to consumers in 1958.<ref name=nytimes/> A television and radio ad campaign, utilizing Black's Mr. Clean mascot, accompanied the launch of the product line.<ref name=nytimes/> The company still uses the Mr. Clean character in its marketing, as of 2014.<ref name=nytimes/>
===Artist and painter=== In addition to his commercial work, Black was also a [[landscape artist]] and a [[portrait painter]].<ref name=nytimes/> In 1956, one of his landscape paintings, complete with depictions of animals, was published in ''[[The Saturday Evening Post]]''.<ref name=nytimes/> An official from the [[United States Department of the Interior]] liked the painting. The Interior Department soon contacted Black and asked him to illustrate a character to promote [[fire prevention|wildfire prevention]], [[Smokey Bear]].<ref name=nytimes/> Black kept a life-sized Smokey The Bear statue on his front lawn at his home in Kettering.
===Death=== Black died at his home in [[Kettering, Ohio]], on March 30, 2014, at the age of 92.<ref name=nytimes/> A member of the Fairmont Presbyterian Church, he was survived by his three sons, Richard, Christopher and Timothy, and seven grandchildren. His wife, Virginia Black, died in 2003.<ref name=nytimes/>
==See also== *[[Commercial character design]]
==References== {{reflist}}
